intro: Adenostemma lavenia var. angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved adenostemma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and its flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in whorled clusters. It is a herbaceous perennial that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with slender, branching stems. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
